net.cloud.server.event.task

Class TaskEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.event.task.TaskEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShutdownService

    public class TaskEngine
extends Object
implements ShutdownService
    The TaskEngine is responsible for running jobs for other parts of the server. Tasks can be run immediately or after a delay. They can also be scheduled to run at a fixed rate every so often. All tasks can be cancelled, as well.
    Submitting a task returns a Future which can be used to cancel the task, and obtain a result. VoidTasks will have a null result.
    The TaskEngine is a ShutdownService, and so its hook will stop execution of tasks.

      • instance

        public static TaskEngine instance()
        Obtain a reference to the TaskEngine. This reference can be used to submit tasks.
        Returns:
        The singleton TaskEngine instance

      • submitImmediate

        public Future<?> submitImmediate(VoidTask task)
        Submit a VoidTask to run as soon as possible.
        Parameters:
        task - The task containing the code to run on the TaskEngine
        Returns:
        A Future to determine when the task completes. A VoidTask will return null from the Future.

      • submitDelayed

        public Future<?> submitDelayed(long delay,
                               VoidTask task)
        Submit a VoidTask to run after waiting some amount of time
        Parameters:
        delay - The amount of time to wait before executing the task
        task - The task containing the code to run on the TaskEngine
        Returns:
        A Future to determine when the task completes. A VoidTask will return null from the Future.

      • scheduleImmediate

        public Future<?> scheduleImmediate(long period,
                                   VoidTask task)
        Submit a VoidTask to run as soon as possible, and run it repeatedly
        Parameters:
        period - The amount of time between each execution
        task - The task containing the code to run on the TaskEngine
        Returns:
        A Future to determine when the task completes. A VoidTask will return null from the Future.

      • getShutdownHook

        public ShutdownHook getShutdownHook()
                             throws NullPointerException
        Obtain the ShutdownHook for the TaskEngine. The hook is created when the object is created, and so NPE shouldn't be an issue. Shutting down the engine prevents tasks from being submitted, and will attempt to allow all currently running tasks to complete.
        Specified by:
        getShutdownHook in interface ShutdownService
        Returns:
        The ShutdownHook responsible for this service
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the hook is not available
